SENT.plain: Karyotyping is important for diagnosis and prognosis of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)
Using fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) either mitotic or interphase cells can be analyzed and a higher number of cells can be screened
This study evaluated the effectiveness of FISH in detecting the most common chromosomal abnormalities [-5/del 5q/-7/+8/del 11q23 and -Y] in 40 patients with MDS

Karyotype detected abnormalities in 35.2% of the patients and FISH in 35%, while some abnormalities remained undetected by each approach but the association of both methods increased the detection rate up to 40%
